headline: Portman gets it wrong on Jackson nomination
author: Editorial Board
sentences: Accusations of Republican justices “mirroring” the activism/legislating “deeds” of Democrat justices neglects citing chapter and verse for such Republican “deeds.” Further, college credentials are one thing, but application of intellect, reason and morality are quite another.

The editorial begins by making comparisons of Democrat versus Republican nominees to the high court indicating from the get-go that the essence of the editorial is emotional/political rather than intellectual.
Thus now-Attorney General Merrick Garland was denied even a hearing on his nomination to the high court by Democratic President Barack Obama.
Rob Portman has gotten good at finding reasons why only Republican presidents should be able to appoint justices to the U.S. Supreme Court.
Portman, Ohio’s junior U.S. senator, did it in 2016 following the death that February of Justice Antonin Scalia.
Portman joined his fellow Republicans in insisting that the seat shouldn’t be filled during an election year.

Comments:
This editorial is so sophomoric it is embarrassing—as if written by a teenager having a hissy fit.
Instead, we’re stuck with Justice Neil Gorsuch, an appointee of Republican President Donald Trump.
Senator Portman’s reasoning for not supporting Judge Jackson is not partisan.
